definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
monism, belief that the universe is made of a single substance

sentences.english: The last is centralization, which is a general trend of English development.
sentences.chinese: 五是一元化，這將是英語發展的必然結果。

sentences.english: The first U. S. Prisident George Washington is on the dollar bill.
sentences.chinese: 首任美國總統喬治華盛頓的像在一元美鈔上。

sentences.english: They always are. Only $1.87 to buy a present for Jim.
sentences.chinese: 只有一元八角七給吉姆買禮物，她的吉姆啊。

sentences.english: Monadic Boolean algebras also have an important connection to modal logic.
sentences.chinese: 一元布爾代數還與模態邏輯有重要聯繫。

sentences.english: Then by adapting the one-element-operator, the number of information bit increases further to maximum.
sentences.chinese: 然後進一步採用一元運算將信息位數增到最大。

sentences.english: Applying the method of mathematical regression analysis, one regression equation was found.
sentences.chinese: 用一元迴歸分析的方法推導出了一個迴歸方程。

sentences.english: I give one yuan for ice cream.
He has only a one-dollar bill.
In a way, it may be the inherent difficulty in monism.
sentences.chinese: 在一定意義上，這也許是一元論的固有困難。

sentences.english: Put in something about the Supernal Oneness. Don't say a syllable about the Infernal Twoness.
sentences.chinese: 說一點天上的一元論，千萬別談地獄的二元論。

sentences.english: Du to bargain a yuan, chopped one yuan agreed to split firmly with him.
sentences.chinese: 杜茸向一元討價還價，一元答應與他七三分帳。

sentences.english: Du to bargain a yuan, chopped one yuan agreed to split firmly with him.
sentences.chinese: 杜茸向一元討價還價，一元答應與他七三分帳。

sentences.english: Any amount of HMT of less than one yuan shall be dismissed.
sentences.chinese: 養路費費額不足一元的部分不計。

sentences.english: It is everybody's responsibility to give. If everyone gives one yuan every month, it will add up to billions of dollars."(3)
sentences.chinese: 若每個人一個月捐一元錢，那將會積成數十億美元。

sentences.english: They replied that they used Dollar Store (i.e. cheap) notebooks for their work.
sentences.chinese: 可他們回答道，我們只用一元店的便宜本子來工作。

sentences.english: Applying the method of mathematical regression analysis, one regression equation is given out.
sentences.chinese: 用一元迴歸分析的方法推導出了一個迴歸方程。

definition: currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
banknote in Jiao units (Mao, one-tenth of yuan)
to convert into/to amount to/to be equivalent to
